First impression was awful. As a FPS guy, I wasn't really a fan of the game at first - it felt clumsy and really unbalanced. However, the more I've played it, the more I've realized that the game is actually really well balanced and the victims aren't really victims, when playing right. Here are three things I'd recommend you do to:

1. Spectate and learn from good players
2. Add good players to your friend list and try to play with them as often as you can
3. Try both roles, you will learn a ton this way no matter which one you decide to main

Update August 2018: I really like the way the devs keep actively working on the game. There have been a lot of bugfixes lately, as well as balance improvements and new cosmetics. Call me silly but I LOVE the new cosmetics and I enjoy the game like never before.

Dead by Daylight ... A legendary game with one word. Generators to complete, hooks to be saved, friends to be rescued, totems to break, gates to open, etc. The game really deserves the money that is given to it and it is my great luck not to be late to realize this game.It is a hunter 4 horses 5 hunting person more than a full genre of cat and mouse chase.It is then the fear of catching the excitement of the chirping of the clueless you hear when you approach the voice and songs I do not have any optimization problems, but I do not think that the killer should be in this game because I think you can see your place until a friend of yours wakes you up. My ideas about this game are in this direction and I would strongly recommend it to anyone who deserves to be placed in the library of games that is definitely not waste of time and money. Good games :))

In general the idea of the game is good. 
Its gameplay is innovative and fun, in principle.
But in reality there are too many things which make the game bad and repitive.
First of all you can see that the devs are not willing to put any effort into the game besides the production of new DLC Content. The lobby often doesnt work properly (in fact it doesnt work in this moment). It is stupid and susceptible to abuse that the killer hosts the Lobby. 
Secondly there are perks in the game which are made to fuck you up as a survivor with killers oneshotting you instantly etc.
Some of the mechanics in the game are not balanced at all from the killers and from the survivors perspective. 
It is just stupid that camping is so effective and that you need to have a lot of luck to actually get a descent killer who doesnt camp or is just a fuck up to play against. 
My greatest concern is not that killers are hard to play against but that some mechanics are not counterplayable or just unfair.

As you can tell if you have read other reviews: there are a lot of redundancies concerning the things that are wrong with the game of whom a lot could be fixed easily.
I really hope that the devs are slowly but surely listening to the critics of the game to enhance it but looking at the status quo this might just be another game which is just fucked up because of the devs not giving a shit.
In summary the game can be fun especially when played with friends but it is incredibly flawed and a lot of things are just not fun at all.
I think they should come out with survivors that the killer cant see or hear , Then we can call the pay to wins cry babies

Amazing game if the assymetrical multiplayer genre interests you. The variety of killers and survivors is enjoyable and will take a long time to get boring, even without the DLC, which is a tasteful nostalgic touch with charecters like Leatherface, Michael Myers and Freddy Kruger. Some of the mechanics like the generators, the trapdoor and the overall concept of the Entity but how the killer can still kill a survivor with the help of Mors Ambitio. The perks and the hexes, the various items etc make this game really vast and addictive. In my opinion it is far better than Friday the 13th.
